disobedience.question: Did I reject Church unity when frustrated with others within?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.description: This is considered sinful because deliberately disregarding prescribed days of fasting represents disobedience to Church authority and fails to honor our spiritual obligation to practice self-denial and penance during sacred times.

disobedience.question: Did I ever use words to belittle the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

disobedience.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: in a state of grave sin
blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowing yourself to be in a state of grave sin, thereby showing disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: while knowingly in a state of grave sin
blasphemy.question: Did you receive Holy Communion while knowingly in a state of grave sin, having failed to prepare your heart through prayer and reflection?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

blasphemy.question: Did I receive Holy Communion while knowing that my heart was not in a state of contrition and that I had unresolved conflicts with others?
blasphemy.description: This mortal sin is a form of sacrilege and profanes the real presence of Christ and shows grave disrespect for the sacrament by receiving unworthily.

extracted_data_phrases: in ways that prioritize self - interest over humility and service
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to subtly influence my decisions and interactions with others in ways that prioritize self-interest over humility and service?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: with those in positions of authority , such as church leaders or community officials
in positions of authority , such as church leaders or community officials
of authority , such as church leaders or community officials
such as church leaders or community officials
ambition.question: Did I allow my desire for power and dominance to influence how I interacted with those in positions of authority, such as church leaders or community officials?
ambition.description: inordinate ambition and the obsession with power corrupts the soul by placing our desire to dominate and control above God's authority, turning us away from humble service and toward prideful self-exaltation.

extracted_data_phrases: by making the accumulation of wealth and possessions a driving force , rather than trusting in God 's providence
rather than trusting in God 's providence
greed.question: Did I make money an idol in my life by making the accumulation of wealth and possessions a driving force, rather than trusting in God's providence?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

greed.question: Did I make wealth and material possessions my top priority in life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

envy.question: Have I secretly harbored feelings of discontent for another's blessings, wishing they would lose them?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others with hurtful words, violating their dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others, using language that was unworthy of my dignity and potentially hurtful to those who heard it?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: with crude or off - color language
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others with crude or off-color language?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

especially during leisure activities such as social gatherings or sporting events
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially during leisure activities such as social gatherings or sporting events?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: on excessive consumption of food and drinks
beyond what 's reasonable for my body
gluttony.question: Have I overindulged in eating or drinking, wasting time on excessive consumption of food and drinks beyond what's reasonable for my body?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I delighted in sharing others' private affairs, even if what was shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I used my words to speak ill of others' personal affairs, even if what I said was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.
